ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to speak ASL, not fluently but close! I learned about Deaf culture, history, and inclusivity.
I was able to develop a foundation pertaining to ASL in regards to everyday signs and the various grammar and structural rules of the language.
An introduction to the language of ASL and learning about deaf culture through various activities both inside and outside the classroom.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths of this course are the professors, the events, and the community! I enjoyed the homework assignments and felt they helped me improve my learning. I enjoyed being remote one day a week, and I hope this continues. I didn't enjoy the assignments where we had to film a story at the same time. It was hard to coordinate the signing.
At times it felt like we were expected to sign with words and phrases that had not been covered in class, but were being tested on homework assignments.

Strengths: language is relatively easy to learn in the beginning, and progresses in difficulty over time. It is more than just a Language as you learn various cultural aspects and history. 
A benefit is that it coincides with English so written translations are not foreign to English-speaking students.
Weaknesses: hours required for service are manageable but quite difficult for those with extracurricular commitments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! This is the best class I've taken at Yale. Amazing community, you'll learn how to communicate with all different types of people! Increase accessibility!
I would recommend this course to another student as it was an approachable way to begin to learn ASL.
I would recommend the course to other students. It is a very interesting and beneficial language to allow for broader communication.
